it's how to have the best meetings in your life i worked at a company a few years ago
where we started doing this technique for our meetings and i'm telling you
it made such a huge difference in the quality of our meetings and
how much more effective we were working together as a team and it's called
lean coffee maybe you've heard of it but it's a way to run a meeting
that is really effective and makes the most efficient use of everyone's time
this same technique can be applied to lots of different kinds of meetings and
that take place within any given organization so here's what you need
you need a bunch of sticky notes you need some markers you need a a kanban board which can be
like a white board um that you can slap your sticky notes onto
you need a timer which could be your your phone someone's phone and you need a good
attitude of course you need a good attitude all the time i'm just saying it really really helps to have a good
attitude when you go into a meeting anyway uh a meeting this is how you run
a lean coffee meeting at the beginning of the meeting you jot down a bunch of
ideas on sticky notes and you put those up on your board
and then you take a few quick minutes to go around and quickly describe
what those uh topics are and then you give folks a chance to vote
and most of the time is two votes per person and you can choose to use those votes
how however you like you can vote uh your two favorite topics or you can vote use both votes on
one topic that you are most passionate about you could experiment with giving people
three votes or whatever and at the end you sort those topics by
the highest voted things and then you start discussing you pull the first the highest voted
topic into the doing lane you set your timer for maybe five minutes and you start
talking and maybe while you're talking you're making some notes and taking jotting down some action items
and when the time is up and the timer goes off everyone gets a
chance to vote if if the majority says
uh thumbs down move on to the next topic or the majority says thumbs up let's stay on this topic for
another five minutes then you do one of those things you either move that card
um and pick up the next one or you set the timer and talk for another five minutes
and by doing so this you know that person that's in a
lot of meetings who just seems to you know they're the most important you know their ideas are the most
important and they they kind of take control of any meeting that they're in to talk about their
most important topics well this mechanism keeps that kind of behavior in check
and it also ends up with the time boxing and everything else
you have more quality talk you know interactions
uh you're more efficient you end up talking about more topics and you talk about the things that are
most important to everyone involved and these meetings can be
extremely powerful in making the best use of your time and of course you know

you know run a lean coffee even remotely you can have a physical board in someone's location
where they have a camera on the board and they they do the the work of of managing the cards

lean kit or uh uh combinize or you know any numbers um the voting might

and productive team that my company has ever seen
if your actions inspire others to dream more learn more do more and become more
you are a leader so said president mutton chops
none of these things require you to be a manager or to have a fancy title
i have one more story that i want to share with you and here in the us we have a holiday
called thanksgiving that happens in november in one particular thanksgiving
in 1982 as was custom in my family we would pile in my mom's
car and we would drive a few hours away to my aunt and uncle's house where a lot
of family would gather together and we would you know spend several hours of the day together we
would eat a big meal together we would play football out in the backyard we you know
we just had a great time kind of as a family reunion well this thanksgiving
1982 i've discovered this device in my cousin's
room the trs-80 uh i don't i don't know if i spent the
entire time uh playing on this computer but i do know that it must have made an
impression on my uncle because sometime after thanksgiving um
my mom got a phone call we got back in the car we drove a few hours away to my aunt and
uncle's house and there waiting for me was a big cardboard box and inside
was a trs-80 cassette drive a floppy drive a dot matrix printer
cables and this book this one kind and very generous
act launched me on a journey of computers and programming and a love for
technology i can't thank my
aunt and uncle enough i continue to be inspired by their example of investing
not only in their family but in the lives of countless others they have made
such an invaluable impact on my life my career my livelihood
i believe without a doubt that you have an amazing opportunity
to impact your family your relatives your community your your workplace
in ways you never know just as an act of kindness a word of
encouragement a small investment of your time you never know
if any of those things could be the catalyst that launches someone else a young
person an old person on a lifelong journey of exploration
joy and livelihood so this is my challenge to you
regardless of the technology that you know regardless of your age your experience
lack of experience regardless of the job title that you may have
you have amazing potential to impact your workplace your family your community and beyond in
significant positive and meaningful ways i challenge you to go maximize your
